d.description: Draw command abstraction and rendering pipeline
d.name: draw-abstraction

d.description: Chose painter's stack (push/pop transform, clip) over flat command buffer. Matches UI hierarchy, natural for nested elements. Similar to gpui, HTML Canvas, Skia.
d.title: Decision: painter's stack model for draw context

d.description: Minimal primitive set - just Quad (rect with background, border, corner radii). Covers 90% of UI. Add Path for custom shapes later, sprites when text needed.
d.title: Decision: start with Quad primitive only

d.description: Will use parley crate for text layout/shaping when we get to text rendering. Not needed for initial draw abstraction.
d.title: Decision: use parley for text

d.description: Will use existing idiomatic Rust crate for color types rather than rolling our own.
d.title: Decision: use palette (or similar) for color

d.description: Use cx.with_transform(t, |cx| { }) and cx.with_clip(bounds, |cx| { }) instead of push/pop. Compiler enforces matching, nesting mirrors UI hierarchy.
d.title: Decision: closure-scoped transform/clip stack

d.description: Use palette instead of hand-rolled color types. Custom color code causes maintenance problems per experience with gpui. palette provides proper color science, SIMD support, and well-tested conversions.
d.title: Decision: use palette crate for color

d.description: Use trait Renderer with generics (Window<R: Renderer>) instead of dyn dispatch or enum. Extensible and zero overhead.
d.title: Decision: trait-based renderer with static dispatch

d.description: GPU-friendly layout - typed vectors enable batching. Device pixels stored directly, no per-primitive conversion at render time.
d.title: Design: Scene holds typed Vec<Quad> in device pixels

d.description: Offset and clip stacks with closure-scoped with_offset/with_clip. Compiler enforces matching. Logical pixels in, device pixels out.
d.title: Design: DrawContext painter's stack

d.description: Single primitive for most UI: bounds, background, border_color, border_widths (Edges), corner_radii (Corners). All in device pixels.
d.title: Design: Quad primitive

d.description: Window creation and event loop with winit
d.name: windowing

d.description: Standard Rust windowing crate. Provides window creation, event loop, raw-window-handle for GPU surface attachment.
d.title: Decision: use winit for windowing
